CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company lodged a constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) in which it alleged that the reasoning of ORG decision was insufficient . It further complained of an excessive length of the seizure of its assets .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) declared the applicant company 's constitutional appeal inadmissible for being manifestly ill - founded . It held that unjustified prolonged seizure of assets could in principle constitute a disproportionate interference with property rights . Nevertheless it did not find that the seizure which had lasted DATE to that date was , , disproportionate . It found the challenged decisions to be neither arbitrary nor in any other way unconstitutional . The decision was served on the applicant company 's lawyer on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed a further request of the applicant company to lift the seizure , at least in part . ORG ( vrchní soud ) upheld the decision on DATE . On DATE ORG , however , quashed that decision finding a violation of the applicant company 's right to property . The court held that the length of the seizure , over DATE , was already unreasonable , which thus disrupted the fair balance between the general interest of fighting serious crime and the protection of the rights of the applicant company . Consequently on DATE ORG lifted fully the seizure of the applicant company 's bank accounts .

Pursuant to Article CARDINAL , prosecuting authorities shall assess on their own preliminary issues arising in course of proceedings ; should a final and binding decision on such an issue be already adopted by a court or another ORG authority , prosecuting authorities shall be bound by it unless it concerns an issue of guilt of accused .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides for rights of a concerned person . According to it anyone whose property was seized , or ought to be seized pursuant to a motion , must be provided with an opportunity to comment on the given case , may attend a hearing , raise own motions , consult the case file within the meaning of DATE , and file appeals provided for by this law .

CARDINAL . Article DATE provides for a seizure of financial instruments deposited on a bank account . Under paragraph CARDINAL , if the facts indicate that the financial instruments on a bank account are destined for the commission of a crime , or have already been used for such purposes , or represent the profit from criminal activities , a president of a chamber and a prosecutor , or the police authority at the pre - trial stage of criminal proceedings , are empowered to seize them .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW , the ORG authority listed in paragraph ( CARDINAL ) lifts or reduces the seizure if such a measure is no more necessary , or it is not necessary to maintain it at the given amount .

CARDINAL . Under LAW ) the owner of a bank account , whose assets are seized , has the right to request at any time that the seizure be lifted or reduced . A decision on such a request must be given without delay . If the request is dismissed , the owner of the bank account can lodge a new request that does not contain new reasons no sooner than DATE after the dismissal became final .
